intro: Stigmaphyllon ellipticum var. ternatum, commonly known as the Brazilian wax tree, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in humid, lowland areas. Its unique foliage makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and landscape design.
